newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish April retail sales value down 1.5 pct m/m-CS.
newsitem.headline: Irish April retail sales value down 1.5 pct m/m-CS.

text.p: The value of Irish retail sales fell a provisional seasonally-adjusted 1.5 percent in April, giving a year-on-year increase of 4.9 percent, Central Statistics Office (CSO) data showed on Friday.

In March, the value of retail sales rose 2.4 percent over the month and was up 6.9 percent year-on-year. This was revised from provisional estimates of a 2.5 percent monthly rise and a 7.0 percent rise on the year.
The CSO said the value index was a provisional seasonally adjusted 139.9 in April and a final 142.0 in March.
